/metadata.summary: Access to the Server's Capability Statement
/metadata.description: All FHIR Servers return a CapabilityStatement that describes what services they perform

get.summary: Return the server's capability statement

/AdverseEvent.summary: manage the collection of resources of type AdverseEvent
/AdverseEvent.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type AdverseEvent

get.summary: Search all resources of type AdverseEvent based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: seriousness
parameters.description: Refine a search for AdverseEvent resources by seriousness of the event. Serious and Non-serious are the only supported values.

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Search for AdverseEvent resources for a specified study ID.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for AdverseEvent resources for a specified patient ID.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/AdverseEvent/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type AdverseEvent
/AdverseEvent/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type AdverseEvent

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/AllergyIntolerance.description: The Manager for resources of type AllergyIntolerance: provides services to manage the collection of all the AllergyIntolerance instances

get.summary: Search all resources of type AllergyIntolerance based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: clinical-status
parameters.description: Refine a search for AllergyIntolerance resources by clinicalStatus. Active is the only supported clinical status to search by.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for AllergyIntolerance resources for a specified patient ID.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/Appointment.summary: manage the collection of resources of type Appointment
/Appointment.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type Appointment

get.summary: Search all resources of type Appointment based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Refine a search for Appointment resources by date. By default, all Appointments are returned. Not supported for scheduled surgeries.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Refine a search for Appointment resources by identifier. Not supported for scheduled surgeries.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for Appointment resources for a specified patient ID.

parameters.name: service-category
parameters.description: Search on the type of appointment. Enter 'surgery' for scheduled surgery appointments, and 'appointment' for all other types of appointments.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Refine a search for Appointment resources by status. By default, all Appointments are returned. Not supported for scheduled surgeries.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/Appointment/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type Appointment
/Appointment/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type Appointment

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

/BodyStructure.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type BodyStructure

get.summary: Search all resources of type BodyStructure based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Refine a search for BodyStructure resources by identifier. Enter using the structure "[system]|[search string]".

parameters.name: morphology
parameters.description: Refine a search for BodyStructure resources by morphology.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for BodyStructure resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for BodyStructure resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: _id

/CarePlan.summary: manage the collection of resources of type CarePlan
/CarePlan.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type CarePlan

get.summary: Search all resources of type CarePlan based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: activity-date
parameters.description: Search for CarePlan resources with questionaires due before the provided date.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Search for CarePlans of the given type. This is a required search parameter.

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Refine a search for Encounter CarePlans to search only the encounters provided. Ignored if not searching for Encounter CarePlans.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for CarePlan resources using a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: part-of
parameters.description: Refine a search for Education CarePlans to include only Education CarePlans that are part of the given Education CarePlans. Ignored if not searching for Education CarePlans.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Refine a search for Encounter, Education, and Care Path CarePlans to search only for encounters, education, or Care Paths with the provided status. Ignored if not searching for Encounter, Education, or Care Path CarePlans.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for CarePlan resources using a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/CarePlan/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type CarePlan
/CarePlan/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type CarePlan

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/CareTeam.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type CareTeam

get.summary: Search all resources of type CareTeam based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for CareTeam resources using a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Refine a search based on the CareTeam's status. Currently only active is supported.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for CareTeam resources using a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/Communication.summary: Manager for resources of type Communication
/Communication.description: The Manager for resources of type Communication: provides services to manage the collection of all the Communication instances

get.summary: Search all resources of type Communication based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: based-on
parameters.description: Refine a search for Education Communication resources to include only Education Communication resources that are documentation for the given Education CarePlans. These should be CarePlans with an education-subcategory of point. Ignored if not searching for Education Communication resources.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Refine a search to include only Communication resources with the given categories.

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Refine a search to include Communication resources from only the encounters provided.

parameters.name: part-of
parameters.description: Refine a search for Communication resources "part of" a specified Task ID. If not provided, all Communications are returned.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for Communication resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for Communication resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

200.description: the resource being returned after being updated

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/Communication/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type Communication

/Condition.summary: Manager for resources of type Condition
/Condition.description: The Manager for resources of type Condition: provides services to manage the collection of all the Condition instances

get.summary: Search all resources of type Condition based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: abatement-date
parameters.description: Search for Conditions with a specified abatement date. This is only used when searching for infections.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Search for Condition resources by category.

parameters.name: clinical-status
parameters.description: Refine a search for Condition resources by clinicalStatus. Only clinical statuses of 'inactive', 'resolved' and 'active' are supported for health concerns and problem list items. Only clinical statuses of 'inactive' and 'active' are supported for infections.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Search for Conditions with a specified code. This is only used when searching for infections.

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Search for Condition resources for specific encounters.

parameters.name: onset-date
parameters.description: Search for Conditions with a specified onset date. This is only used when searching for infections.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for Condition resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: recorded-date
parameters.description: Search for Conditions with a specified recorded date. This is only used when searching for infections.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for Condition resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

200.description: the resource being returned after being updated

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/Condition/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type Condition

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

parameters.description: A string that will match the Device.deviceName.name field. Not case sensitive.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: The patient in whom this device is implanted. This is a required parameter.

parameters.name: udi-carrier
parameters.description: The UDI barcode string - matches static UDI.

parameters.name: udi-di
parameters.description: The UDI device identifier (DI).

parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/DiagnosticReport.summary: manage the collection of resources of type DiagnosticReport
/DiagnosticReport.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type DiagnosticReport

get.summary: Search all resources of type DiagnosticReport based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Refine a search for DiagnosticReport resources by category.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Refine a search for DiagnosticReport resources by code.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Refine a search for DiagnosticReport resources by specifying a date or date range that a DiagnosticReport was resulted or recorded. Enter dates in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD[THH:MM[:SS][TZ]]]]). Local server time is assumed if time zone information is not included. Not supported by Care Plan Goal.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Refine search by specifying an identifier, such as the internal order ID or the accession number. Not supported by Care Plan Goal.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for DiagnosticReport resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for DiagnosticReport resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/DiagnosticReport/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type DiagnosticReport

/DocumentReference.summary: Manager for resources of type DocumentReference
/DocumentReference.description: The Manager for resources of type DocumentReference: provides services to manage the collection of all the DocumentReference instances

get.summary: Search all resources of type DocumentReference based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: Further refine a search for a given set of DocumentReferences on a patient by specifying a Practitioner ID that corresponds to the author of the document. Currently only supported for correspondence and imaging-result search.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Refine a search for DocumentReference resources by category.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Further refine a search for a given set of DocumentReferences on a patient by specifying a date or date range in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD[THH:MM[:SS][TZ]]]]]) that corresponds to the document creation time. Local server time is assumed if time zone information is not included.

parameters.name: docstatus
parameters.description: Further refine a search for a given set of DocumentReferences on a patient by specifying a docStatus. By default, all docStatuses are returned. Not supported for correspondence, imaging-result, or questionnaire-response search.

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Search for DocumentReference resources for a specified encounter ID. Not supported for correspondence, imaging-result, or questionnaire-response search.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for DocumentReference resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Further refine a search for a given set of DocumentReferences on a patient by specifying a date or date range in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD]]) that corresponds to the time of the service that is being documented. Not supported for questionnaire-response search.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Further refine a search for a given set of DocumentReferences on a patient by specifying a status of the document. Currently only supported for questionnaire-response with a status of current.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for DocumentReference resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Further refine a search for a given set of DocumentReferences on a patient by specifying a type code to return only documents of that type. Use the format: type=<code> to search all supported systems with that code or type=<system>|<code> to further refine the search to one code system. Not supported for questionnaire-response search.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

200.description: the resource being returned after being updated

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/DocumentReference/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type DocumentReference
/DocumentReference/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type DocumentReference

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

put.summary: Update the current state of the resource

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

200.description: the resource being returned after being updated

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/Encounter.summary: manage the collection of resources of type Encounter
/Encounter.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type Encounter

get.summary: Search all resources of type Encounter based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: class
parameters.description: Refine a search for Encounter resources by class. By default, all classes are returned.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Refine a search for Encounter resources by date. By default, all Encounters are returned. Enter dates in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD[THH:MM[:SS][TZ]]]]]). Local server time is assumed if time zone information is not included.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Search for Encounter resources by encounter identifier in the format <code system>|<code>

parameters.name: onlyscannable
parameters.description: Refine a search for Encounter resources to scannable encounters only. By default, all Encounters are returned. Use a value of "true" to only return scannable encounters. Can only be used when the application is launched from Hyperspace.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for Encounter resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for difference references.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for Encounter resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for difference references.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/Encounter/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type Encounter
/Encounter/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type Encounter

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

/MedicationRequest.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type MedicationRequest

get.summary: Search all resources of type MedicationRequest based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: authoredon
parameters.description: Further refine a search for MedicationRequest resources for a given patient by specifying a date or range of dates for when the medication was ordered. Note: all medications will be returned regardless of date range provided on the search.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Refine a search for MedicationRequest resources by category. By default, the search returns all categories. Categories of inpatient, outpatient, community, and discharge are supported.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Refine a search for MedicationRequest resources for a given patient by specifying a date or a range of dates for when the medication was active.

parameters.name: intent
parameters.description: Refine a search for MedicationRequest resources by one or more intents.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for MedicationRequest resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" and "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Refine a search for MedicationRequest resources by one or more statuses.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for MedicationRequest resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/Observation.summary: Manager for resources of type Observation
/Observation.description: The Manager for resources of type Observation: provides services to manage the collection of all the Observation instances

get.summary: Search all resources of type Observation based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: based-on
parameters.description: Refine a search for Observation resources by specifying a ServiceRequest associated with the Observation. (currently Genomics-only)

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Refine a search for Observation resources by category or SNOMED code. Epic categories are laboratory, vital-signs, social-history, core-characteristics, LDA, LDA-property, LDA-assessment, functional-mental-status, periodontal, labor-delivery, newborn-delivery, and obstetrics-gynecology. Supported SNOMED codes include 384821006, 118228005, 252275004, 275711006, 68793005, 395124008, 314076009, 19851009, and 405825005.

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Refine a search for Observation resources by code, including but not limited to LOINC code, SNOMED code, flowsheet row IDs, or SmartData Identifiers. Codes associated with the labor-delivery and newborn-delivery categories require that the category be specified.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Refine a search for Observation resources by specifying a date or date range that a result- or vital sign-based Observation was resulted or recorded. This can also be used to refine the search results for labor-delivery, obstetrics-gynecology, and LDA based Observation searches. Enter dates in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD[THH:MM[:SS][TZ]]]]). Local server time is assumed if time zone information is not included.

parameters.name: focus
parameters.description: Refine a search for Observation resources by specifying a Reference associated with the Observation. (currently only SmartData and obstetrics-gynecology)

parameters.name: issued
parameters.description: Refine a search for Observation resources by specifying a date or date range that a social-history-based Observation was made available. Enter dates in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD[THH:MM[:SS][TZ]]]]). Local server time is assumed if time zone information is not included.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for Observation resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for Observation resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

200.description: the resource being returned after being updated

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/Observation/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type Observation

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

put.summary: Update the current state of the resource

/Patient.summary: Manager for resources of type Patient
/Patient.description: The Manager for resources of type Patient: provides services to manage the collection of all the Patient instances

get.summary: Search all resources of type Patient based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources using an address string.

parameters.name: address-city
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources using the city for a patient's home address. You can use this parameter along with other address parameters.

parameters.name: address-postalcode
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources using the postal code for a patient's home address. You can use this parameter along with other address parameters.

parameters.name: address-state
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources using the state for a patient's home address. You can use this parameter along with other address parameters.

parameters.name: birthdate
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources using a date of birth in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD).

parameters.name: family
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources by family (last) name. You can use the family parameter along with other name parameters to search by a patient's name. Family name searching supports exact matching, "sounds like" matching, and patient aliases.

parameters.name: gender
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources using the following gender codes: female, male, other, or unknown.

parameters.name: given
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources by given (first) name.  You can use the given parameter along with other name parameters to search by a patient's name. Given name searching supports both exact and "sounds like" matches. Patient aliases and dominant name aliases (ex. Bob for Robert) are also supported.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources by a patient's identifier. You can use the identifier parameter as the only parameter in a search or in conjunction with other parameters. A patient's identifier must be in the format {<code system>|}<code> or {<ID Type>|}<ID>.

parameters.name: legal-sex
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources using the following gender codes: female, male, nonbinary, x, other, or unknown.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources by a patient's name. To search on specific name parts use the name part parameters, such as family or given. This parameter is ignored if any name part parameters are used.

parameters.name: own-name
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources by patient's own last name, usually used in non-US names. You can use the own-name parameter along with other name parameters to search by a patient's name.

parameters.name: own-prefix
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources by patient's own last name prefix, usually used in non-US names. You can use the own-prefix parameter along with other name parameters to search by a patient's name, but own-name must also be included.

parameters.name: partner-name
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources by patient's spouse's last name, usually used in non-US names. You can use the partner-name parameter along with other name parameters to search by a patient's name, but own-name must also be included.

parameters.name: partner-prefix
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources by patient's spouse's last name prefix, usually used in non-US names. You can use the partner-prefix parameter along with other name parameters to search by a patient's name, but own-name must also be included.

parameters.name: telecom
parameters.description: Search for Patient resources using a patient's home phone number, cell phone number, or email address.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

200.description: the resource being returned after being updated

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/Patient/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type Patient
/Patient/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type Patient

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/Practitioner.summary: manage the collection of resources of type Practitioner
/Practitioner.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type Practitioner

get.summary: Search all resources of type Practitioner based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: address
parameters.description: Any part of an address (street, city, etc.) where a practitioner can be visited. When used, family is also required.  Only respected if no other address parameters are populated. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

parameters.name: address-city
parameters.description: The city where a practitioner can be visited. When used, address-state is also required. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

parameters.name: address-postalcode
parameters.description: The zip code where a practitioner can be found. When used, family is also required.

parameters.name: address-state
parameters.description: The state where a practitioner can be found.  When used, family is also required.  Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

parameters.name: family
parameters.description: A practitioner's family (last) name. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

parameters.name: given
parameters.description: A practitioner's given (first) name.  When used, family is also required. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: A practitioner's identifier in the format <code system>|<code>.  When this parameter is provided, all others (except _id) are ignored.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Any part of a practitioner's name.  For full names, format should be first last. When specified, family and given are ignored. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/Practitioner/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type Practitioner
/Practitioner/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type Practitioner

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/PractitionerRole.summary: manage the collection of resources of type PractitionerRole
/PractitionerRole.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type PractitionerRole

get.summary: Search all resources of type PractitionerRole based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: Refine a search for a PractitionerRole by entering a valid email address.  Code system is ignored.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description: Search for PractitionerRoles using identifiers. A code system is required. The code must be prepended with URN:OID.  Some codes may need to be URL encoded prior to query.

parameters.name: location
parameters.description: Search for PractitionerRoles using a Location ID. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: Search for PractitionerRoles using an Organization ID. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

parameters.name: phone
parameters.description: Refine a search for a PractitionerRole by entering a valid phone number.  Code system is ignored.

parameters.name: practitioner
parameters.description: Search for PractitionerRoles for a specified Practitioner ID. Only the first instance of this parameter is respected.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: Refine a search for a PractitionerRole by entering a valid role.  System must be included.

parameters.name: specialty
parameters.description: Search for PractitionerRoles for a given specialty.  A code system is required.  Depending on the organization, NUCC may be supported.

parameters.name: telecom
parameters.description: Refine a search for a PractitionerRole for a specific telecom.  System must be specified as either 'phone' or 'email'

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/PractitionerRole/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type PractitionerRole
/PractitionerRole/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type PractitionerRole

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

/Procedure.summary: manage the collection of resources of type Procedure
/Procedure.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type Procedure

get.summary: Search all resources of type Procedure based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Refine a search for Procedure resources by category. Only the following values are supported: 103693007 (diagnostic procedures), 387713003 (surgical procedures), 9632001 (nursing procedures, Netherlands only), and 225317005 or freedom-restricting-intervention (restricting intervention, Netherlands only) are supported.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Refine a search for Procedure resources by specifying a date or date range that a Procedure was resulted. Enter dates in ISO format (YYYY[-MM[-DD]]). Not supported by nursing procedures or restricting interventions.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for Procedure resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for Procedure resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/Procedure/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type Procedure

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Search for QuestionnaireResponses by encounter

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for QuestionnaireResponses for a specified patient. You can also use "subject" equivalently

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for QuestionnaireResponses for a specified patient. You can also use "patient" equivalently

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

requestBody.description: The new state of the resource

/ServiceRequest.summary: manage the collection of resources of type ServiceRequest
/ServiceRequest.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type ServiceRequest

get.summary: Search all resources of type ServiceRequest based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: Refine a search for ServiceRequests of a particular category. By default, all ServiceRequests are returned.

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Search for ServiceRequest resources for specific encounters. If not provided, all ServiceRequest results are returned.

parameters.name: onlyscannable
parameters.description: Refine a search for ServiceRequest resources to scannable only. By default, all ServiceRequests are returned. Use a value of "true" to only return scannable ServiceRequests. Can only be used when the application is launched from Hyperspace.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search ServiceRequest resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: requester
parameters.description: Refine a search for ServiceRequest resources by individual making the request. By default, all ServiceRequests are returned.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Refine a search for ServiceRequest resources by status. By default, all ServiceRequests are returned. Statuses of draft, active, completed, revoked, and unknown are supported.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search ServiceRequest resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/ServiceRequest/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type ServiceRequest
/ServiceRequest/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type ServiceRequest

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

/Task.summary: manage the collection of resources of type Task
/Task.description: Access to services to manage the collection of all resources of type Task

get.summary: Search all resources of type Task based on a set of criteria

parameters.name: code
parameters.description: Specify community-resource for CRRN tasks, episode-checklist for Episode Checklist tasks. When nothing is specified, all valid tasks are returned.

parameters.name: encounter
parameters.description: Further refine the search for a task by specifying the encounter associated with the task. For Episode Checklist tasks, only tasks created in this encounter will be returned.

parameters.name: focus
parameters.description: Specify the EpisodeOfCare FHIR ID to search for Episode Checklist tasks.

parameters.name: patient
parameters.description: Search for Task resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Restrict the search for tasks based on task status. Only respected by Episode Checklist tasks.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Search for Task resources for a specified patient ID. You can use "patient" or "subject" equivalently, but they cannot be used at the same time for different references.

parameters.name: _id
parameters.description: FHIR resource IDs for the desired resources. If _id is used in a search, all other parameters will be ignored.

parameters.name: _count
parameters.description: Number of results per page.

/Task/{rid}.summary: Read/Write/etc resource instance of type Task
/Task/{rid}.description: Access to services to manage the state of a single resource of type Task

get.summary: Read the current state of the resource

ETag.description: Version from Resource.meta.version as a weak ETag

summary.name: _summary
summary.description: Requests the server to return a designated subset of the resource

format.name: _format
format.description: Specify alternative response formats by their MIME-types (when a client is unable acccess accept: header)

pretty.name: _pretty
pretty.description: Ask for a pretty printed response for human convenience

elements.name: _elements
elements.description: Requests the server to return a collection of elements from the resource

count.name: _count
count.description: The maximum number of search results on a page. The server is not bound to return the number requested, but cannot return more
